intro: Equisetum ramosissimum var. abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian horse tail, is a perennial plant belonging to the Equisetaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, unbranched stems that are covered with small, scale-like structures. The plant produces spore-bearing cones at the base of the stem, which are typically found in clusters. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. This variety is notable for its ancient lineage, dating back to the Paleozoic era.
